p: In recent years, enzyme inhibitory strategies are considered as one of the most effective strategies in combating global health problems including Alzheimerâ€™s diseases (AD) [ 66]. The natural inhibitors of cholinesterases (ChEs) from the plant origin for the management of cognitive/mental disorders have gained interest due to the presence of polyphenolic compounds such as quercetin, catechin, bergenin, and rutin which have several health benefits [ 67, 68]. Aromatic and medicinal plants may have an important role in oxidative stress protection, which are good sources of acetylcholinesterase and butyrylcholinesterase inhibitor to controlling AD [ 69]. A recent study showed that the different pure isolated metabolites from B. ciliata have potent acetylcholinesterase and butyrylcholinesterase inhibition activity [ 44]. Our study revealed that crude methanol, ethyl acetate, and water extract of B. pacumbis to have great inhibitory potential toward acetylcholinesterase and butyrylcholinesterase. However, hexane extract does not reveal any inhibition towards these enzymes. Remarkably methanol extract has significant inhibitory activities against all enzymes.
